newsitem.title: GABON: Gabon ruling party trounces opponents in poll.
newsitem.headline: Gabon ruling party trounces opponents in poll.

text.p: Gabon President Omar Bongo's ruling party swept 47 of 55 parliamentary seats decided after elections last week, electoral officials said on Wednesday.

A small party allied with Bongo's Democratic Party won one seat. The main opposition National Woodcutters Rally (RNB), which won control of the capital Libreville during chaotic October municipal elections, only managed three seats. Four others went to minor opposition parties and an independent.

A runoff ballot will take place on December 29 for 62 seats of the 120-member assembly still undecided. There will also be reruns in three constituencies where polling did not take place in the chaotic main election on December 15.
The elections were Gabon's second multiparty legislative polls. The first were in 1990 when a wave of democratic reform swept across Africa after the fall of Soviet-bloc communism.
